attributes.action: More help with funding for nursery places for parents affected by COVID
attributes.additional_details:
My child is missing out on early years education and social interaction because of COVID 19. 
I have been made redundant due to COVID 19 but we are just outside the bracket for funding. We have no spare income to pay for nursery fees or childcare. 
If I don’t find full time work she won’t qualify when she is 3 either. With the current unemployment levels this is very real  possibility. 
Our younger children are forgotten
attributes.background: I would like the government to offer more help to parents struggling due to COVID We currently don’t qualify for funding for our 2 year old to go to nursery even though I have been made redundant through COVID 19.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Reform the Childcare System: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550767

Keep 30 hours free childcare if parents lose their job due to Covid: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551482

Provide 5 days a week free childcare for ages 0-4 for all working parents: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550625

15 hour free childcare 1 to 2 year olds: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551061

If you want the Government to change eligibility for free childcare in a different way to the above petitions you could start a new petition stating clearly what changes you want the Government to make to current eligibility.
